CUSTOM_ADDRESS_INFO: Non-original @protonmail addresses can never be deleted (only disabled). This means that once you create an address it will always count towards your address limit. Custom domain addresses must be disabled before they can be deleted. Custom domain addresses can only be deleted if all messages associated with that address are deleted. Learn more about addresses here.
CUSTOM_THEME_INFO: Custom themes from third-parties can potentially betray your privacy. Only use themes from trusted sources.
DASH_UPSELL_1: Upgrading to a paid account is the best way to support ProtonMail, but you can also donate any amount.
DASH_UPSELL_2: Your donation helps us support more users and continue to develop ProtonMail as free and open source software.

DISPLAY_NAME_INFO: This is the 'From' name that people will see when you email them.
DKIM_INFO_1:
ProtonMail supports DKIM signing for custom domains! To protect {{ ctrl.domain.DomainName }} with DKIM authentication, please add the following TXT record into the DNS for {{ ctrl.domain.DomainName }}. This can typically be done in the control panel of your domain name registrar. {{ 'LEARN_MORE' | translate }}

Please add the follow TXT record. Note, DNS records can take several hours to update.
DKIM_INFO_2: Keep this record in your DNS for as long as you want to use DKIM. You can change its Value to off to disable DKIM
DMARC_INFO_1:
If you have set both SPF and DKIM, DMARC allows you to specify how other email services should deliver email for your domain if both SPF and DKIM checks have failed. This can make it harder for spammers pretending to be you but may also cause delivery issues if not done properly. {{ 'LEARN_MORE' | translate }}

Typical DMARC record. Note, you MUST change this before adding it to your DNS.
DMARC_INFO_2:
p=none is report only mode so no effect on email delivery

address@yourdomain.com is where you will receive DMARC reports from other email services
DNS_PROPAGATE_MESSAGE: It can take up to a day for DNS changes to update.
DOMAIN_INFO_1: Add a domain that you own to your ProtonMail account.

LAYOUT_INFO: ProtonMail supports both column and row layouts for the inbox. Using this setting, it is possible to change between the two layouts.
LOGGING_INFO: You can enable authentication logging to see who and when your account is accessed. We will record the IP address that accesses the account and the time, as well as failed attempts.

MX_INFO_1:
Before you can receive emails for your custom domain addresses at ProtonMail, you need to add the following MX record to the DNS of {{ ctrl.domain.DomainName }}. This can typically be done in the control panel of your domain name registrar. {{ 'LEARN_MORE' | translate }}

Please add the following MX record. Note, DNS records can take several hours to update.
MX_INFO_2:
Delete any other MX records or make sure ProtonMail's Priority is the lowest number.

If {{ ctrl.domain.DomainName }} is actively receiving emails, create all used email addresses in Step 3 before changing MX record to ensure a smooth transition.

SAFARI_ATTACHMENT_HEADING: Safari does not fully support downloading encrypted attachments.
SAFARI_ATTACHMENT_MESSAGE:
Your attachments are secure and encrypted, but to download them requires extra work. We recommend using a different web browser such as Chrome or Firefox for a better user experience.

To download attachments in Safari:

  1. Click your attachment once to decrypt it. Once decryption finishes you will see a download arrow icon appear.
  2. Right-click on your attachment and choose 'Download Linked File As...'
  3. You will be prompted to save the attachment.
  4. Name your attachment from 'unknown' to the correct name, including the file extension.

For more help please contact us directly: support@protonmail.com
SAFARI_DOWNLOAD_KEY: Safari doesn't support downloading of keys. We are working on a fix for this.
SCREENSHOT_IMGUR_MESSAGE: A screenshot of your current page will be sent to us automatically, so we can help debug your problem! Screenshots are hosted using a 3rd party, public service [imgur].
SECURITY_CONTACT_MESSAGE: Contact us at security@protonmail.com for critical security issues.
SIGNUP_CTA_MESSAGE: Take back your privacy! Creating your free secure email account takes less than 2 minutes in most cases.
SPF_INFO_1:
SPF is used to specify who is allowed to send email for the domain so we strongly recommend including ProtonMail in your SPF record. Please add the following TXT record into the DNS for {{ ctrl.domain.DomainName }}. This can typically be done in the control panel of your domain name registrar. {{ 'LEARN_MORE' | translate }}

Please add the following TXT record. Note, DNS records can take several hours to update.
SPF_INFO_2: If you want to keep an existing SPF record, you can just add include:_spf.protonmail.ch to it after the v=spf1. Do not create multiple SPF records.

VISIT_KB_MESSAGE: Visit our updated knowledge base
WELCOME_MODAL_INTRO: You now have an encrypted email account! Below are optional settings you can use to customize your account. You can always find these on your Settings page.
WELCOME_STEP_1_MESSAGE: This short tutorial will show you the main features of your new ProtonMail account. For more information, you can also check out the Welcome email we have sent you. If you ever want to view this tutorial again, you can access it by clicking your username in the upper right corner.
WELCOME_STEP_1_TITLE: Welcome to your new encrypted email account
WELCOME_STEP_2_MESSAGE: ProtonMail allows you to fully customize your inbox experience. By clicking (1) you can quickly switch between two possible layouts. You can set a default layout, set your composer style, adjust button layouts, and even switch themes under Settings --> Appearance (2)
WELCOME_STEP_3_MESSAGE: Labels are a powerful tool to manage your inbox. You can add and remove labels from selected emails by clicking the Label button (1). You can also add, delete, and edit labels by clicking on Label Settings (2).
WELCOME_STEP_4_MESSAGE: If you have questions or need help, please visit our support page to find troubleshooting guides and contact our support team. If you find a bug in ProtonMail, please let us know! You can send us a bug report by clicking Report Bugs (1)
YOU_CAN_PAY_WITH_PAYPAL: It's also possible to donate with PayPal or Bitcoin.
YOUR_NEW_FEATURES_ARE_NOW_AVAILABLE: Your new features are now available
